February 9. 1959
Or. Maurice F. Seay, Director
The Division of Education
W.K. Kellogg Foundation
250 Champion Street
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Maurice:
During these iast years, i have developed a kind of "allergic-depressive"
expectation set with respect to the morning mail delivery. When—as some¬
times happens—the reality exceeds even my most dismal expectations, my
prejudice is confirmed and 1 simply kick another leg off the pine desk
(supplied by the furniture factory of the Ohio State Penitentiary).
February 5th, however, proved to be such a memorable and heart-warming de¬
parture from this pattern that it will remain for many years to come one
of my real “red-letter" days. This was the day when i received from Harry
Skornia copies of your January 30th letter stating the terms of a new
3-year NAEB grant and his official response of February 3rd.
As chairman of the NAEB Foundation Committee of last year, as a former NAEB
president, and as a worker in the somewhat varied vineyard of educational
radio and television broadcasting for many years, I felt a sense of pleasure
and pride and gratitude which one is privileged to experience only on rare
occasions.
The long-time understanding and support from the W.K. Kellogg Foundation
of NAEB*s operations, its goals and professional-ethical concerns (which
our friend, Harry Skornia, in a very real way epitomizes) has been vital
to the grovtfth and development of NAEB. And many of us believe NAEB has made
and will make fundamental contributions to American society in this increas¬
ingly important area of educational communications. To me, this new Kellogg
grant represents a kind of “reaffirmation of faith" in a)) that the NAEB is
and hopes to be. While the fiscal aspects of the grant are vita! as you know,
the spiritual and moral encouragement It provides really transcends the dollar
contribution. Please know how deeply grateful all of us are for both aspects
of the support.
Richard B. Hull, Director
Radio and TV Broadcasting
RBH/mh
P.S. 1 am also pleased to report the local plumbers who masquerade under
the title of M.D. assure me that all pipes and fittings have been re¬
stored and function is normal. I hope the Michigan medics now give
you the same "all clear."
be: Skornia, Harley, Schooly.
